content.description:
It's certainly possible someone else has done this route. This is an obvious, wavy 5.6 line on the east side from the saddle with a ridge connecting the other Noddles. A few bushes growing in the crack, but it was easy to clean up. Afterthe Â topout, leave the rope if heading for the an 8' boulder at highest summit of formation. It is rather rotten and has a reachy mantel on its south side. A spot is psychologically helpful - rotten V0.

To reach the boulder, head a bit north around blocks circling up to the highest point.

To descend, there are large blocks set back about 15' from the top of the main route suitable for setting up webbing to rappel.
content.protection: Finger to hand size protection. You can build an anchor with #1 - #3 Camalots in a vertical crack formed by a leaning block 25' beyond topout of the main pitch.
